description:
Index of retail prices

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
61131 Retail price index

Definition:
The index of retail prices measures the price movement at
the stage of retail sale. It is an index of selling prices,
covering sold goods, but excluding services.
The retail price index is delimited in institutional terms;
it refers to goods for resale sold by retail enterprises to
households. The results are released in accordance with this
institutional delimitation, in a breakdown by the
internationally coordinated Classification of Economic
Activities, 2008 edition.

name: Index of retail prices
